metadata.Title: CVE-2021-39149 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: XStream is a simple library to serialize objects to XML and back again. In affected versions this vulnerability may allow a remote attacker to load and execute arbitrary code from a remote host only by manipulating the processed input stream. No user is affected, who followed the recommendation to setup XStream's security framework with a whitelist limited to the minimal required types. XStream 1.4.18 uses no longer a blacklist by default, since it cannot be secured for general purpose.

notes.Note: sahnaseredini> for `trusty` and `xenial`, the code is not present and the available pocs cannot be exploited

criterions.comment: libxstream-java: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
